title: [JIT] Allow Tuples/Lists to be passed and returned from python
body_html:
Right now attempting to return a tuple results in:

The only supported return types are tensors, ints and floats

Code:

import torch

@torch.jit.script
def hi(x):
    return 3, (4, 5)

print(hi)
print(hi(torch.FloatTensor(3)))

Tuples and lists should also be tested as arguments to python functions.

Python functions called from script should also be tested for their ability to take/return tuples and lists.

Note: functionality for taking/returning lists is present, but needs to be implemented.

Python functions called from script should also be tested for their ability to take/return tuples and lists.
Note: functionality for taking/returning lists is present, but needs to be implemented.
body:
Right now attempting to return a tuple results in:

```
The only supported return types are tensors, ints and floats
```

Code:
```
import torch

@torch.jit.script
def hi(x):
    return 3, (4, 5)

print(hi)
print(hi(torch.FloatTensor(3)))
```

Tuples and lists should also be tested as arguments to python functions.

Python functions called from script should also be tested for their ability to take/return tuples and lists.

Note: functionality for taking/returning lists is present, but needs to be implemented.
